helpgrid.innerhtml: A billing schedule can include fixed fees, items, service items, scheduled usage, managed assets, and actual usage. Each of these details is copied to a sales order and the sales orders are copied to bill batches.
Each fixed fee is copied to a sales order when a bill batch is created for this billing schedule.
Each item is copied to a sales order when a bill batch is created for this billing schedule.
Each service item is copied to a sales order when a bill batch is created for this billing schedule.
Each scheduled usage fee is copied to a sales order when a bill batch is created for this billing schedule.
Each asset or configuration item with a specified classification is copied to a sales order when a bill batch is created for this billing schedule.

Choose one of the options for billing unbilled usage fees for this billing schedule. Either bill unbilled usage fees for all financial periods or bill unbilled usage fees only for prior financial periods. Usage for dates earlier than the agreement start date are not billed.

radiobutton.label: Bill Usage Only for Prior Financial Periods

helpgrid.innerhtml: Specify details about the price schedule. If you bill a fixed fee amount, fill in the amount and then select the type of fixed amount. If you bill for project milestones, the fixed amount value is billed for this milestone. To bill for SLA breaches, specify a price schedule that applies to sales orders.
You can automatically create bill batches for all price schedules for this agreement. Set the billing type to Automatic and specify schedule details.

Specify the details and billing rules for this price schedule. A price schedule can use only one of the billing rules options. Enter information for included pricing, or minimum pricing, or price quotes.
The Price Schedule will be applied to a ticket, work order, or sales order if all of the conditions are met.

section.description: You can specify classification criteria for this price schedule select the internal priority operator (such as EQUAL, GREATER, or LESS), and enter a priority value. If you specify criteria, the ticket, work order, or sales order must meet these conditions to apply the price schedule.
section.label: Price Schedule Criteria

table.description: You can select the service group or services to which this price schedule applies. The ticket, work order, or sales order must reference one of the items specified in order to apply the price schedule.
table.label: Included Services

table.description: You can click Add First Row to select existing structured conditions that compare fields and enable you to select records based on the result. The ticket, work order, or sales order must meet these conditions in order to apply the price schedule.
table.label: Conditions

section.description: Click Maximize Additional Price Schedule Criteria Section to write your own SQL conditions, or use the SQL Expression Builder to build expressions.
section.label: Additional Price Schedule Criteria

helpgrid.innerhtml: The Price Schedule will be applied to a ticket, work order, or sales order if all of the conditions are met.

table.description: You can select the locations or location hierarchies for this price schedule or leave these fields blank to apply the plan to all records with any locations or location types.
table.label: Location and Location Hierarchies

helpgrid.innerhtml: The Price Schedule will be applied to a ticket, work order, or sales order if all of the conditions are met.

table.description: You can select the assets or asset types for this price schedule, or leave these fields blank to apply the plan to all records with any assets or asset types.
table.label: Asset Type and Assets

helpgrid.innerhtml: The Price Schedule will be applied to a ticket, work order, or sales order if all of the conditions are met.

include.description: You can select the configuration items for this price schedule or leave these fields blank to apply the plan to all records with any configuration items.

helpgrid.innerhtml: For billable work, the labor cost is calculated either from the craft price, the craft markup percentage, the labor price book, or the default markup percentage. If more than one type is specified, a craft price overrides a craft markup, a craft markup overrides a labor price book, and a labor price book overrides a default markup. If specified, and if premium hours are reported, a craft price might be modified by premium pay rules.

The materials cost is calculated from one of these sources: the material pricing list, the markup for the commodity item, the item in the price book, or the default markup or discounts. If more than one type is specified, the material pricing list overrides the markup for the commodity item, the markup for the commodity item overrides the item in the price book, and the item in the price book overrides the default markup or discount. Customer supplied parts should be listed in the Material Pricing table.

You can enter a positive or negative percentage value to apply a markup or discount to the standard service cost or price. You can enter a positive or negative percentage value to apply a markup or discount to the service cost.
You can enter a positive or negative percentage value to apply a markup or discount to the tool cost or price.
Enter a description for the revised agreement. Click OK when finished.
The preview dates are based on the values specified in the schedule. The first 20 preview dates are shown and they start with the next bill date.
Sales Orders that are associated with this agreement.
